perturbation.original_text:
(a) HCI shall pay MLX a guaranteed fixed sum of [*] US per annum during the
     Initial Term of this Agreement to be paid out as a monthly payment of [*]
     US (the "Monthly Payment"). This Monthly Payment shall be due by the 10th
     day of each month;
perturbation.changed_text:
(a) HCI shall pay MLX a guaranteed fixed sum of [*] US per annum during the
     Initial Term of this Agreement to be paid out as a monthly payment of [*]
     US (the "Monthly Payment"). This Monthly Payment shall be due by the 30th
     day of the following month;
perturbation.explanation: Modifying the payment due date to the 30th of the following month introduces potential inconsistency with standard business practices and could violate prompt payment laws in some jurisdictions, which often require payment within a shorter timeframe (e.g., 15-30 days).
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state-specific prompt payment laws for commercial transactions. The Ontario Construction Act requires payments to be made within 28 days, though this act doesn't directly apply, it showcases the general guideline of the Canadian legal system.

perturbation.original_text:
(c)  Both Parties shall keep true and accurate books and records of all revenue
     generated as a result of the Co-Branded Site. Either Party shall have the
     right from time to time to audit and make extracts of the books and records
     of the other, insofar as said books or records pertain to the terms of this
     Agreement. Any such audit shall take place upon not less than seven (7)
     days advance written notice, during normal business hours of normal
     business days and at reasonable intervals. Any such audit shall be at the
perturbation.changed_text:
(c)  Both Parties shall keep true and accurate books and records of all revenue
     generated as a result of the Co-Branded Site. Either Party shall have the
     right from time to time to audit and make extracts of the books and records
     of the other, insofar as said books or records pertain to the terms of this
     Agreement. Any such audit shall take place upon not less than two (2)
     days advance written notice, during normal business hours of normal
     business days and at reasonable intervals. Any such audit shall be at the
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the advance written notice for audits to two days is unreasonable and may conflict with legal standards of fairness and adequate notice, potentially hindering the audited party's ability to prepare and cooperate. Auditing standards often require a more substantial notice period to ensure proper preparation and prevent undue disruption.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with general principles of contract law requiring reasonable notice. It is contradicting 'reasonable intervals' from the original text.

perturbation.original_text:
During the Term of this Agreement
and for a period of six (6) months thereafter, MediaLinx shall not use or
publicly disclose the data collected from users of the Co-Branded Site if such
use is for the purpose of providing health information, advertisements, or
products that compete with those that reside on the Co-Branded Site.
perturbation.changed_text:
During the Term of this Agreement
and for a period of one (1) month thereafter, MediaLinx shall not use or
publicly disclose the data collected from users of the Co-Branded Site if such
use is for the purpose of providing health information, advertisements, or
products that compete with those that reside on the Co-Branded Site.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the restriction period on using user data for competitive purposes to one month is insufficient to protect the confidentiality of user data and could conflict with privacy regulations, especially concerning health information, which often require longer protection periods to prevent misuse or unauthorized disclosure. The Canadian Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA) outlines privacy regulations and may require a longer retention policy depending on the sensitivity of the information.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with privacy regulations (e.g., PIPEDA in Canada) regarding the reasonable retention and use of personal information, especially health-related data.
